metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10801 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - negligible.
metadata.Description:
TIFFClientOpen in tif_unix.c in LibTIFF 3.8.2 has memory leaks, as demonstrated by bmp2tiff.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10801` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.9-5
libtiff-tools - 4.0.9-5
libtiff5 - 4.0.9-5
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.9-5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> upstream removed the bmp2tiff utility in 4.0.7 this is a memory leak in a command-line tool, we will not be fixing this issue in precise, trusty or xenial. Marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: tiff package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.9-5').
